Sensex, Nifty, Share Price LIVE:  India’s equity benchmarks, Sensex and Nifty, traded largely flat on Friday, continuing a seven-month losing streak despite optimism sparked by the Reserve Bank of India’s dovish stance and recent regulatory reforms.

By 1.30 p.m., the Sensex dropped down 8 points to 80,974, while the Nifty fell 12  points to 24,823.

items.title: Proposals worth $13 billion pour in for electronics parts scheme
items.summary: India's Electronics Component Manufacturing Scheme (ECMS) has attracted $13 bn in investment proposals, nearly doubling its target and significantly exceeding expectations. This unprecedented interest, including 60% from MSMEs, positions India to become a global electronics manufacturing hub, reducing import dependence and creating 141,000 direct jobs.

items.title: Consumer cos cheer as GST cuts light up Navratri sales, demand highest in more than a decade
items.summary: Indian consumer goods and auto companies experienced their best Navratri sales in over a decade, with growth ranging from 25% to 100%. Reduced GST and product prices fueled this surge, significantly boosting consumer sentiment. Maruti Suzuki doubled sales, while electronics brands like Haier saw high double-digit growth, setting a positive tone for the upcoming Diwali season.

items.title: Banks start to see benefits of rate cuts, advances rise
items.summary: Indian Bank's advances rose 13% on a year-on-year basis, the highest quarterly growth since the first quarter of FY24. Its deposits also rose 12%, the highest since the second quarter of FY23. Its provisional advances stood at Rs 6.22 lakh crore, while deposits were Rs 7.76 lakh crore for the quarter ending September 2025.

items.title: Banks' entry to make M&A funding a hard bargain
items.summary: For years, banks were barred from financing mergers and acquisitions through equity purchases, curbs that were put in place to prevent leverage buyouts. While banks could lend against hard assets such as plants, brands, and factories, they were not permitted to fund share purchases that gave acquirers control of firms.

items.title: Global aircraft financiers flag issues with India's repossession draft rule
items.summary: The draft, which seeks to implement the Cape Town Convention (CTC), makes it mandatory for creditors-through the Irrevocable De-registration and Export Request Authorisation (IDERA) holder-to clear a wide set of dues before exporting aircraft from the country. This includes unpaid employee wages and PF, airport operator fees, navigation charges, fuel bills and GST on leases or financing.

items.title: D2C brands double retail store presence

items.title: Telcos get time till December 31 for 5G EMF exposure self-certification
items.summary: Telcos receive an extension for 5G EMF self-certification. They will not submit certificates until December 31. This decision follows industry concerns about testing equipment scarcity. The Department of Telecommunications extended the deadline by four months. India's 5G rules are still stricter than global guidelines. This extension provides telcos more time for compliance.

items.title: Portal rollout soon for speedy transfer of unclaimed shares
items.summary: The corporate affairs ministry is launching an integrated portal this month to expedite the transfer of old unclaimed shares and dividends to investors. This initiative, after two years of planning, will allow investors to check and submit claims. Additionally, a new dedicated CEO post for the IEPFA has been approved to bolster staff and streamline processes.

items.title: Franchise flicks lose their shine as big bucks bounce back small

War 2-part of Yash Raj Films' ambitious Spy Universe-managed collections of just Rs 236.55 crore in India against a production budget estimated between Rs 300-400 crore, according to box office tracker Sacnilk.

items.title: Multiple firms get into Li-ion cell production amid rising demand

TDK Corporation recently opened a large battery plant in Haryana. Dixon Technologies also established a unit for cell manufacturing. This expansion meets growing demand from electronics industries. Government schemes support these crucial developments.

items.title: RBI weighs uniform compensation policy for consumer grievances
items.summary: The RBI is proposing a uniform compensation policy for all regulated entities and considering additional payouts for complaints resolved by its ombudsman, aiming to bolster customer grievance redressal. While banks largely back a uniform approach, they oppose extra compensation at the regulator's level, citing potential for exaggerated claims.

In the pre-owned luxury handbags section, the platform features handbags from brands like Bottega Veneta, Fendi, Gucci and Louis Vuitton. In watches, the platform has timepieces from brands like Omega, Breitling, TAG Heuer, besides others.

items.title: Putin warns Trump’s India tariffs could boomerang on US economy

items.title: PC Jeweller Q2 revenue up 63%, cuts debt by 23% in September quarter
items.summary: PC Jeweller reported a robust 63% year-on-year revenue growth in Q2 FY26, fueled by strong festive demand for gold jewellery. The company significantly reduced its debt by 23% this quarter, aiming to become debt-free by the end of FY226 through planned equity raises of Rs 1,800 crore from promoters and investors.

items.title: Government invites proposals under PRIP scheme for industry, startup projects; may provide assistance up to ₹100 cr
items.summary: The government has invited applications for its Rs 5,000 crore Pharma-MedTech innovation scheme, aiming to support around 300 projects in new medicines, biosimilars, and medical devices. Revised guidelines offer enhanced financial assistance for MSMEs and startups, including higher support for strategic priority areas. Applications opened on October 1 via a digital portal.

items.title: Govt invites application for selecting BPCL CMD after PESB fails to identify suitable candidate
items.summary: The last day for filing applications is October 21, 2025

items.title: Banks poised for ₹5 lakh cr lending opportunity as RBI opens door to M&A funding
items.summary: The Reserve Bank of India will permit banks to finance corporate acquisitions. It will also remove the cap on large corporate exposures. These regulatory changes are set to unlock significant lending opportunities. Over Rs 5 lakh crore in new credit demand is expected. Banks will fund corporate mergers and expansion plans. This move will reshape India's corporate funding landscape.

items.title: Kretinsky sells Thyssenkrupp steel stake as JV plans falter
items.summary: The stake sale ends lengthy talks over what could have become a German-Czech steel and energy giant, discussions that have not made any measurable progress since Kretinsky bought a fifth of Thyssenkrupp Steel Europe last year

items.title: IFB Agro exits UAE venture
items.summary: Closure includes winding up of IFB Agro Marine (FZE) and its representative office in Dubai

items.title: Agri-drone firm AVPL launches tech park to indigenise drone components
items.summary: The company’s co-founder and chairperson Preet Sandhu says manufacturers can work on revenue sharing basis

items.title: India to emerge as next petrochemicals powerhouse with $37 bn capex push: S&P
items.summary: India plans a USD 37 billion investment in petrochemicals. This aims for self-sufficiency. India will become a significant global player by 2030. This expansion follows China's similar moves. It will intensify oversupply in Asia. Asian exporters face challenges. India's large domestic demand will protect local producers. India will overtake the US as the second-largest polyethylene consumer.

items.title: PepsiCo's new challenge: Making its chips and sodas colourful without artificial dyes
items.summary: The company said it's still finding new ingredients, testing consumers' responses and waiting for the US Food and Drug Administration to approve natural alternatives

items.title: Banks’ enhanced lending to deepen stock markets
items.summary: RBI ups limits for lending by banks against shares from ₹20 lakh to ₹1 crore and for IPO financing from ₹10 lakh to ₹25 lakh per person

items.title: India and Japan: Why the perfect economic alliance is still underperforming on FDI
items.summary: Japan needs India’s youth and land; India needs Japan’s capital and tech. Despite a perfect geopolitical fit and a massive new investment promise, Japanese funding is underperforming, leaving a vast economic opportunity waiting to be finally unlocked.

items.title: Inflation could be much lower than RBI estimates in FY26 and FY27: SBI report paints optimistic picture
items.summary: Inflation in FY26 and FY27 could be lower than the RBI's estimates, driven by positive domestic conditions, with the GST rate cut being a significant factor, the SBI report says. &nbsp;

items.title: Mixed Bag for Gujarat PSU scrips in H1 FY 2026
items.summary: According to data compiled from the bourses, GMDC emerged as a standout performer among the listed state PSUs with 125.17% surge in its stock price, rising from ₹265.35 to ₹597.50 between March 28 and Sep 30

items.title: RBI keeps status quo on rates, announces measures to boost bank credit
items.summary: RBI Governor Sanjay Malhotra observed that the growth outlook remains resilient supported by domestic drivers, despite weak external demand

items.title: India must not let this import dependence choke its infrastructure build-up
items.summary: Our ambitious infrastructure push can’t progress without tunnel-boring machines, but import reliance leaves projects vulnerable to foreign export curbs of the sort China uses. Local production could mitigate the risk of our infra development being held hostage by external powers.

items.title: IPO frenzy revives as large corporates queue up with primary issuances
items.summary: The profitable listing of the recent IPOs and ample liquidity in the economy key factors behind the drive

items.title: From gourmet fruits to artisanal breads, instant grocery delivery is going luxe
items.summary: The shift reflects quick-commerce platforms' push to chart a viable path to profitability by nudging customers toward higher-value, higher-margin baskets.

items.title: Coal demand to remain sluggish in current fiscal year: mjunction
items.summary: Coal demand is currently sluggish due to an extended monsoon and increased supply, leading to a market glut and high stock levels across the system. While coal-based generation shows negative growth, demand is expected to grow mid-to-long term from new thermal power projects, necessitating a balance between supply and demand to protect investments.

items.title: EU to propose doubling tariff rate on steel imports to 50%
items.summary: The move will align the bloc’s rate with the US, which has sought to push back against overcapacity from China

items.title: JICA extends $75 million loan to ECOM to support small coffee growers in Asia, including India
items.summary: C0-financed by ADB, the project will also support growers in Indonesia, Papua New Guinea and Vietnam

items.title: Uni Linc India Pvt Ltd’s ballpoint pen facility formally inaugurated in South Gujarat
items.summary: Uni Linc India Pvt Ltd is a joint venture between Linc Ltd and Tokyo-based Mitsubishi Pencil Co Ltd

items.title: Thumbs-up: An emoji that’s both a digital crutch and an everlasting puzzle
items.summary: This proliferating online emoji is a staple for efficient communication but can also leave its recipients foxed. While it’s practical, witty and versatile, it also holds a mirror to human behaviour. Time for its avid users to frame a code of emoji etiquette?

items.title: India takes the first step on land, women participation reforms: A new economic chapter?
items.summary: Part of Viksit Bharat goals, the next-generation reforms are aimed to tackle some of the most intractable challenges standing in the way of growth in India

items.title: Electric two-wheeler registrations rise 2% month-on-month in September
items.summary: TVS Motor leads with 21,132 units

items.title: Coal demand to remain sluggish in current fiscal year: mjunction
items.summary: From a mid-to-long term perspective, however, coal demand is expected to keep growing, albeit at a slower rate, in view of the strong pipeline of thermal power projects being planned and announced

items.title: Turkey Anticipates Manageable Fine to Settle Halkbank-US Dispute
items.summary: Turkey anticipates settling a long-running dispute with the US administration over sanctions busting allegations against state lender Turkiye Halk Bankasi AS with a manageable fine, according to a person familiar with the matter.

items.title: Non-residents can invest in Indian companies’ non-convertible debentures and commercial papers via rupee accounts
items.summary: Experts say such a move will add to the attraction of Indian debt market while also aiding in internationlaisation of Indian rupee

items.title: Revenue of alcohol industry to grow 10-12% on premiumisation, price growth in FY26
items.summary: In contrast, the spirits segment, comprising Indian Made Foreign Liquor (IMFL) and country liquor, may see a volume decline largely on account of higher taxation and increased selling prices

items.title: Sazerac betting big on growing Indian whiskey market; plans to launch premium products
items.summary: Global spirits giant Sazerac considers India central to its long-term growth, eyeing the booming premium whiskey market. Introducing American Bourbons like Buffalo Trace, the company aims to leverage rising disposable incomes and consumer curiosity for new spirits.

items.title: US H-1B visa path just got complicated: Universities now face new restrictions
items.summary: The new bill targets universities and researchers, signaling a major shift in US immigration policy. Find out how this impacts your career.

items.title: Deep depression to bring heavy rain in Bengal
items.summary: In its forecast for Kolkata till Friday morning, the IMD said that a few spells of light to moderate rain with or two intense spells of rain is very likely to occur.

items.title: Small businesses use AI, innovative methods to push sales this festival season
items.summary: Partnering with bike riders to deliver Fast Moving Consumer Goods (FMCG), gifts to using Artificial intelligence in real time, small businesses are taking recourse to various methods to improve product sales

items.title: Novo, Lilly weight-loss drugs should be first option obesity treatments, European doctors say
items.summary: Semaglutide, the active ingredient in Novo's Wegovy and Ozempic, and tirzepatide, sold as Zepbound and Mounjaro by Lilly, are so effective that they should be the first choice in almost all cases when substantial weight loss is necessary, according to a new guideline from the European Association for the Study of Obesity published in Nature Medicine.

items.title: Mint Explainer: Are zero-balance accounts about to become the new normal in banking?
items.summary: Draft norms seek to expand BSBD services with mobile banking, cheque books and free digital transactions

items.title: Anti-H-1B moves like Project Firewall seem popular: They may even help Trump win back some voters
items.summary: Trump’s crackdown on immigration appears to have enough political traction for him to double down on it. After a hefty H-1B visa fee hike comes Project Firewall that will target employers. It could reshape the tech sector, spark legal battles and perhaps help Republicans retain control of Congress.

items.title: Banking sector to see 17.7 CAGR profit over FY26-28, earnings recovery expected from Q2 FY26: Report
items.summary: The report envisages that private sector banks under coverage are expected to report a 7.3 per cent (y-o-y) decline in net profit for Q2FY26

items.title: Ex-SocGen Banker, Traders Facing Insider Trial Over €18 Million Gains
items.summary: An ex-Societe Generale SA banker and a group of traders suspected of making about €18 million ($21.1 million) from an insider tip on a US stock about a decade ago were ordered to face a criminal trial in France, according to people familiar with the matter.

items.title: Electronics Component Manufacturing Scheme attracts  ₹1.15 trillion in investment proposals: Ashwini Vaishnaw
items.summary: The Electronics Component Manufacturing Scheme has garnered investment proposals of  ₹1.15 lakh crore, exceeding targets for investment, employment, and production. The scheme aims to enhance India's electronics supply chain and is projected to create 1.41 lakh jobs.

items.title: India's diesel exports to Europe probably surged to record in September, sources say
items.summary: India's diesel exports to Europe likely reached an all-time high in September, driven by robust profits from European refinery maintenance and widened east-west spreads. Total diesel exports also hit a five-year high. While October exports may dip due to Diwali, high product cracks could still encourage some sales, though EU sanctions pose future uncertainty.

items.title: Private project plans in first half of fiscal is at a 15-year high
items.summary: Indian firms alone account for 94% of the ₹9.95 lakh crore announced by the sector; government and foreign investment proposals slump

items.title: Housing sales in Mumbai region, Pune fall 17 pc in Jul-Sep: PropEquity
items.summary: Housing sales in Mumbai and Pune regions dropped 17 percent in July-September. This decline was attributed to lower demand and rising property prices. Realtors, however, expressed confidence in a festive season recovery. They cited long-term demand drivers and infrastructure upgrades. An uptick in absorption was anticipated for the second half of the fiscal year.

items.title: Banks likely to report soft Q2 performance amid NIM pressures and higher credit costs: Axis Securities
items.summary: As the earnings season for the second quarter of the current financial year is set to begin, banks are expected to report another soft performance, according to a report by Axis Securities.

items.title: Centre considers Rs 20,000 crore risk guarantee fund to boost infrastructure
items.summary: India is considering a Rs 20,000 crore risk guarantee fund for its infrastructure sector, managed by NCGTC. This initiative aims to attract private investment by covering development and non-commercial risks, crucial for meeting the USD 4.51 trillion infrastructure spending target by 2030. The fund seeks to boost economic growth and the 'Make in India' initiative.

items.title: Sometimes car tech goes too far. Automakers are admitting it
items.summary: Automakers like Tesla, Mercedes-Benz, and Audi are re-evaluating their push for futuristic technology, admitting some innovations don't meet customer needs or solve real problems. Facing market turbulence, companies are now prioritizing proven tech and customer feedback, simplifying designs and even reverting to older, more intuitive systems. This marks a shift towards practicality over novelty.

items.title: Centre analysing data to review difficulty level of entrance exams like JEE, NEET
items.summary: The Centre is considering reviewing the difficulty level of JEE and NEET entrance exams to align them with the Class 12 curriculum. This initiative aims to reduce students' reliance on coaching centres, based on feedback from an expert panel. The Ministry of Education-appointed panel is examining issues like 'dummy schools' and schooling system gaps that foster coaching dependency.

items.title: India’s GST overhaul has much to write home about but we can’t ignore its fiscal consequences
items.summary: The country’s revised goods and services tax regime is more coherent and rational than what it replaced. Prices should fall while inverted levies get sorted out and small units are incentivized to register for GST. But don’t forget the downside risk: It could strain the public exchequer.

items.title: Festival season, GST rationalisation boost auto fuel demand in September
items.summary: Diesel and petrol consumption rebound after monsoon slump; Diesel up 6.4% y-o-y; petrol rises 7.5%

items.title: Procter & Gamble to shut down business in Pakistan, following Shell and Pfizer exits
items.summary: Tide and Gillette maker to shut down local operations as part of sweeping overhaul

items.title: TCS Layoffs: IT giant offering two years' severance package to laid off employees, says report — Key details
items.summary: The TCS layoffs amid company restructuring will primarily affect employees whose skills have become redundant or those who have not upskilled themselves to keep up with shifting client demands.

items.title: SKF India group to invest up to ₹1,460 cr on automotive, industrial verticals by 2030
items.summary: Post demerger, the group eyes scale-up with new plant in Pune, and deeper OEM, industrial sector integration

items.title: India's copper industry flags CEPA threat as imports from UAE surge
items.summary: Imports remained low in FY23 and FY24 due to phased tariff reductions under CEPA

items.title: India's hotel story: Luxury soars while mid-market battles oversupply, slow growth
items.summary: Luxury hotel rates in India have surged, while budget options remain affordable. Recent GST cuts for mid-market hotels could stimulate growth. However, the rapid expansion of hotel supply may lead to challenges in balancing demand, particularly in smaller markets.

items.title: Talking to Meta’s AI? Your chats will soon decide which ads you get
items.summary: Meta Platforms said on October 1 it would begin using people's interactions with its generative AI tools to personalise what they see as well as their advertisement feeds.

items.title: Centre receives ₹1.15-lakh crore worth investment proposals for Electronics Component Manufacturing Scheme: Vaishnaw
items.summary: He said government has envisaged getting investment of only around ₹59,000 crore under the scheme

items.title: SKF India group to invest up to Rs 1,460 cr on automotive, industrial verticals by 2030
items.summary: Auto components major SKF India is investing up to Rs 1,460 crore by 2030 following its demerger into separate automotive and industrial entities. The industrial arm, SKF India (Industrial) Ltd, plans Rs 800-950 crore for a new Pune plant and expansion, while SKF Automotive will invest Rs 410-510 crore to boost capacity for India's evolving mobility sector.

items.title: Electronics Component Scheme draws ₹1.15 lakh crore proposals, beats targets
items.summary: The Electronics Component Manufacturing Scheme has attracted investment. Union Minister Ashwini Vaishnaw announced proposals worth Rs 1.15 lakh crore. This amount exceeds initial targets for investment and employment. The scheme aimed for Rs 59,000 crore investment. It also promises 1.41 lakh jobs, surpassing the 91,600 target. The application window for capital equipment remains open.

items.title: India’s copper industry sounds alarm as UAE imports surge under CEPA
items.summary: The Indian Primary Copper Producers Association warns that surging copper rod imports from the UAE under CEPA threaten domestic investments. Despite no local refining, UAE firms convert imported cathodes with minimal value addition, exploiting phased tariff reductions. IPCPA urges revising product-specific rules and capping the excessive tariff rate quota to protect India's copper industry.

items.title: Banking sector to see earnings recovery from Q2FY26, strong 17.7% CAGR profit expected over FY26-28: Report
items.summary: The Indian banking sector is set to witness earnings recovery in the second half of FY26, after a muted September quarter performance marked by margin pressure, moderate credit growth and a decline in profitability across private and public lenders, according to a research report by Motilal Oswal Institutional Equities.

items.title: A surge in patent applications doesn’t mean India has suddenly turned innovative
items.summary: India’s patent filings have soared but rising numbers mask a troubling reality: most patents show little innovation, with limited market impact. Many seem like marketing stunts. Worthy inventions take a lot more than ticking legal boxes to qualify for intellectual property protection.

items.title: GHCL seeks anti-dumping duty as cheap Chinese imports squeeze margins
items.summary: GHCL Ltd, India's second-largest soda ash producer, has sought anti-dumping duties on cheap imports from China and other global exporters, as surging shipments erode local margins. The company faces pressure from China's massive surplus capacity, despite operating at 98% capacity and eyeing future demand from India's solar energy sector.

items.title: Ahead of IPO, WeWork India collects ₹1,348-cr from anchor investors
items.summary: WeWork India has allotted 2,08,06,548 equity shares to 67 funds at ₹648 apiece.

items.title: Pension funds hail NPS reforms, call new framework a game-changer for sector
items.summary: Experts highlight that the new framework gives pension funds the freedom to create their own schemes, thereby offering more flexibility and options for subscribers.

items.title: Scrutiny please: The social sciences seem overburdened by dodgy research claims
items.summary: The knowledge ecosystem has shaped society in profound ways but its authority is often taken for granted. To make it useful, we must stop giving it a free pass, question its claims and approach its prescriptions with humility. In social sciences, many of these are perspectives, not universal truths.

items.title: SEBI nod to Nuvama's mutual fund entry, approves role as sponsor
items.summary: This will enable Nuvama Wealth Management to launch schemes under mutual fund including Specialized Investment Fund category

items.title: Govt issues notices to 25 offshore crypto assets cos for non-compliance of money laundering law
items.summary: The government had in 2023 brought virtual digital asset providers under the ambit of its law on money laundering

items.title: Indian Overseas Bank waives minimum balance charges for savings accounts
items.summary: The decision by the Chennai-headquartered bank aims to provide relief to customers and make the banking experience easier

items.title: Oil Ministry invites applications for BPCL top job
items.summary: BPCL is the fourth company in the oil sector where PESB couldn't find a suitable candidate since 2021. PESB in May 2023 did not make any recommendation for the top post at IOC and the task was then entrusted to an SCSC

items.title: RBI reports 98.35% return of  ₹2000 banknotes following withdrawal announcement
items.summary: The facility for depositing and exchanging  ₹2000 banknotes was made available at all bank branches across the country until 07 October 2023. This widespread accessibility was aimed at ensuring that individuals and entities had ample opportunity to exchange or deposit their  ₹2000 notes.

items.title: Crude oil rises on Russia sanctions fears after 3-day losing streak
Oil Ministry invites applications for BPCL top job
items.summary: The Oil Ministry has invited applications for Bharat Petroleum Corporation Ltd's chairman and managing director post, following the Public Enterprises Selection Board's inability to find a suitable candidate. This marks a recurring trend in the oil sector, where search-cum-selection committees have been formed to fill top roles at IOC, HPCL, and ONGC.

items.title: Roche Pharma commits 1.5 billion Swiss franc investment in India over next five years
items.summary: The company announced this investment as part of the  $100 billion commitment made by the four-nation EFTA bloc under a trade pact with India

items.title: Revlon India eyes top five spot in the beauty care market
items.summary: Targeting young girls, the company plans to introduce a new glimmer collection made of lips and face. It is also placing a strong focus on the colour cosmetics business, which holds a 15 per cent market share.

items.title: Bay depression beats timeline to intensify as deep depression
items.summary: A twin depression over north-east Arabian Sea seen moving further away from Gujarat coast

items.title: Kia to bridge India’s hybrid gap with new compact SUV plans in 18 months
items.summary: Kia’s strategy underscores how automakers are broadening their lineups to meet stricter emission norms

items.title: In an Indian hinterland town, hotels become Japanese havens for auto expats
items.summary: Increased Japanese investment in Gujarat's Vithalapur has drawn many auto engineers, leading to a boom in Japanese-friendly hotels offering familiar food and amenities. However, expats face significant cultural challenges due to Gujarat's strict vegetarianism and difficult alcohol prohibition laws, impacting their comfort and daily life.

items.title: MPC likely to cut rates in December if external headwinds remain and growth starts to decelerate: Report
items.summary: The evolution of this outlook, however, will depend on upcoming GDP prints, high-frequency indicators and developments in the external trade environment

items.title: SEBI launches validated UPI handles, 'SEBI Check' to curb payment fraud
items.summary: Investors can verify whether the account they are transferring money to belongs to a registered intermediary

items.title: Hollywood horror sequence: What looks like protection could lead to dejection in America’s film industry
items.summary: As globalized filmmaking lets US studios shave millions off budgets and helps keep blockbusters profitable, Trump’s new 100% film tariff is likely to hit American movies the hardest. Plus, anyone brave enough to accept the task of ensuring compliance will face a near ‘mission impossible.’

items.title: India eyes $250 billion investments from EFTA nations: Goyal
items.summary: The European Free Trade Association (EFTA) members are Iceland, Liechtenstein, Norway, and Switzerland

items.title: If external headwinds remain and growth starts to decelerate, MPC likely to cut rates in December: Report
items.summary: ICICI Bank predicts the Monetary Policy Committee may cut policy rates in December if domestic growth decelerates amid persistent external headwinds. A noticeable dovish shift in the MPC's language and the Governor's recent remarks signal potential monetary easing.

items.title: Inflation likely to be much lower than RBI projections in FY26 and FY27: SBI Report
items.summary: RBI appears to have left the door open for future rate cuts, given the low inflation forecasts and the recent downward adjustments in growth estimates, says SBI report

items.title: Inflation likely to be much lower than RBI projections in FY26 and FY27: SBI Report
items.summary: SBI forecasts much lower inflation for the current and next financial years. Domestic factors like monsoon progress and GST rationalisation support this outlook. RBI recently revised its FY26 inflation projection downwards. The central bank also increased its FY26 GDP growth estimate.

items.title: Piyush Goyal lauds TEPA coming into force; says India engaging with world from position of strength
items.summary: Union Minister Piyush Goyal announced the India-EFTA Trade and Economic Partnership Agreement (TEPA) has come into force, marking a significant milestone in India's engagement with developed nations. This landmark deal, featuring a robust IP chapter, targets USD 100 billion investment and one million jobs, reflecting India's growing global confidence and strength.

items.title: Mint Quick Edit | Can Trump end the Gaza war? His bold plan faces stiff obstacles
items.summary: Trump’s latest Gaza plan promises an end to war and keeps alive the prospect of a two-state solution, but its success hinges on Hamas’s surrender, Israel’s internal politics and the credibility of the US as a peace guarantor. Deal-making doesn’t get harder than this.

items.title: Bank holiday today: Are banks closed today on October 2 for Gandhi Jayanti, Dussehra and Vijaya Dashami?
items.summary: Bank holiday today, 2 October: There is a bank holiday today at all banks in India, including SBI (State Bank of India), ICICI Bank, HDFC Bank, Punjab National Bank and others for Gandhi Jayanti, Dussehra and Vijaya Dashami

items.title: Donald Trump's Pfizer deal could change how governments tackle medicine prices
items.summary: Pfizer's agreement with the Trump administration raises critical questions about market freedom and regulatory overreach.

items.title: September GST collection rises 9%, defies slowdown expectations
items.summary: India's GST collections hit Rs 1.89 lakh crore in September, a 9.1% year-on-year increase, defying expectations of a consumption slowdown. This robust growth, reflecting August transactions, indicates a resilient domestic economy and strong discretionary demand. Experts anticipate continued positive collection trends, buoyed by the upcoming festive season, despite future rate rationalization.

items.title: No rate cut, but RBI trims rules, drops overlapping biz regulations in credit push
items.summary: The RBI kept the repo rate unchanged at 5.5% and raised FY26 GDP growth to 6.8%, while flagging tariff-related headwinds and unveiling measures to boost banking and credit flow.

items.title: RBI rings in banking changes, leaves key rate unchanged
items.summary: The Reserve Bank of India relaxed several rules on Wednesday. This aimed to boost credit and economic growth. Individuals can now borrow more for stock investments. Companies can use bank funding for takeovers. Businesses gained access to loans from abroad. The RBI governor raised the GDP outlook. He lowered the inflation projection for FY26.

items.title: Musk becomes first person to hit $500 billion net worth, Forbes list shows
items.summary: Tesla stock has been driving the increase in Mr. Musk's net worth; the shares have risen more than 14% so far this year

items.title: RBI to ease norms for banks’ corporate exposure via market securities, to repeal earlier framework
items.summary: RBI governor Sanjay Malhotra said that the central bank is not worried about a resurgence in concentration risk given the introduction of other frameworks monitoring corporate exposure since then, and given the significant reduction in corporate credit exposure of banks over this period.

items.title: FIU-IND issues notices to 25 offshore crypto exchanges
items.summary: India's Financial Intelligence Unit (FIU-IND) has issued notices to 25 offshore cryptocurrency exchanges, including Huione and Paxful, for violating anti-money laundering laws. These platforms were serving Indian users without mandatory registration, prompting FIU-IND to order the takedown of their apps and URLs.

items.title: Tracking of pledged $100 billion investments by EFTA in works, says Swiss minister
items.summary: India and the EFTA bloc have activated their TEPA, establishing a monitoring mechanism for EFTA's $100 billion investment commitment over 15 years. This significant pact, contingent on India's GDP growth, allows New Delhi to partially withdraw tariff concessions if investment targets are not met, strengthening the rule of law.

items.title: Factory activity slows to 4-month low in September
items.summary: India’s manufacturing PMI slipped to a four-month low of 57.7 in September, with slower growth in new orders, output, and hiring, according to an HSBC-S&P Global survey. Despite robust input cost inflation, business confidence hit a seven-month high, driven by GST cuts and stronger export demand offsetting US tariff pressures.

items.title: Cabinet raises wheat MSP by 6.6% ahead of rabi sowing, clears major pulses push
items.summary: The Centre raised wheat MSP by 6.6% to ₹2,585/quintal for 2026-27, ahead of rabi sowing, and set a production target of 119 mt. It also approved a ₹11,400 crore six-year mission to boost pulses output by expanding cultivation, distributing seed kits, and promoting high-yield, climate-resilient varieties.

items.title: Festive boost: Cabinet clears 3% DA, DR hike from July 1, 2025
items.summary: The Union cabinet approved a 3% increase in dearness allowance and dearness relief for 12 million central government employees and pensioners, effective July 1, 2025, aiming to spur consumption. Additionally, a ₹6,957 crore project for four-laning NH-715 in Assam was sanctioned, featuring an elevated corridor through Kaziranga National Park to protect wildlife.

items.title: Swiss chocolates and watches get cheaper as India-EFTA trade pact kicks in
items.summary: The trade agreement between India and the four-nation EFTA bloc has come into force, securing a $100 billion investment commitment for India over 15 years. India will phase out customs duties on products like Swiss watches and chocolates over a decade.

items.title: Forex rules relaxed to help export, import processing
items.summary: In another relief, RBI has simplified the closure of small-value transactions. The earlier relaxation for exporters under the Export Data Processing and Management System (EDPMS) has now been extended to importers through the Import Data Processing and Management System (IDPMS).

items.title: Overseas borrowing may soon get easier and cheaper for Indian companies
items.summary: "Based on the review, a revised framework that provides for expansion of eligible borrower and recognised lender base, rationalisation of borrowing limits, rationalisation of restrictions on average maturity period, removal of restrictions on the cost of borrowing for ECBs, review of end-use restrictions and simplification of reporting requirements, is proposed to be introduced," said Sanjay Malhotra, governor, RBI.

items.title: India might be the 'perfect' emerging market, strategist says
items.summary: EMQQ Global founder and chief investment officer Kevin Carter sits down with Julie Hyman to discuss investing in emerging markets, like India (^NSEI), China (000001.SS), and Latin America, compared to US stocks (^DJI, ^GSPC, ^IXIC). To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Market Catalysts.

items.title: Rupee pushed to the front in cross border transactions
items.summary: The Reserve Bank of India (RBI) proposed measures to promote wider use of the rupee in cross-border trade, particularly with neighboring countries Nepal, Bhutan, and Sri Lanka, and other major trading partners.

items.title: Sitharaman links pension reforms to the Atmanirbhar Bharat vision
items.summary: NPS reforms were aimed at addressing both the supply and demand sides of India’s pension framework, from the industry as well as the consumer perspective, says Nirmala Sitharaman.

items.title: Hopeful to sign trade pact with EU soon: Piyush Goyal
items.summary: Commerce and Industry Minister Piyush Goyal said India hopes to soon sign a free trade agreement (FTA) with the European Union (EU) to boost trade and investment. Negotiations resumed in June 2022 after an eight-year gap and aim to conclude by December. The FTA covers 23 areas, including goods, services, investment, intellectual property, and sustainable development.

items.title: Would like to have a bilateral investment treaty with India: Swiss Minister
items.summary: Switzerland seeks a bilateral investment treaty with India. This follows a new trade pact with EFTA nations. The pact includes a 100 billion dollar investment commitment over 15 years. India is negotiating similar treaties with other countries. These agreements protect and promote investments. India aims to improve its investment regime. The country signed two such treaties in 2024.

items.title: MoS textiles & MEA in Moscow as India eyes Russian textile market
items.summary: Minister Pabrita Margherita travels to Moscow this week. India is seeking new markets for its textile exports. US tariffs impacted Indian textile exporters. Russia is a market for these goods. Margherita will meet Russian officials and inaugurate a textile fair. Over 100 Indian companies will participate. The fair aims to boost trade with Russia and CIS nations.

items.title: India-EFTA trade pact comes into force
items.summary: Commerce and Industry Minister Piyush Goyal said the pact will unlock new opportunities for trade, investment and job creation, benefiting people and businesses

items.title: Govt raises wheat MSP by 6.59% to Rs 2,585 per quintal for 2026-27
items.summary: The government announced a 6.59 per cent increase in the Minimum Support Price (MSP) for wheat to Rs 2,585 per quintal for the 2026-27 marketing year. MSPs for five other rabi crops were also hiked, aiming to ensure remunerative prices for farmers and incentivise crop diversification, aligning with the 1.5 times cost of production policy.

items.title: Andhra Pradesh's demand for transmission fee waiver troubles Adani solar deal
items.summary: Without waiver, cost could rise 40% to ₹3.49 per unit

items.title: IRDAI alerts public to fraudulent consumer education website
items.summary: The general public is advised to refrain from accessing or engaging with the fraudulent website and to rely only on the IRDAI’s official portals, the regulator said

items.title: Centre releases  ₹1.01 trillion as tax devolution to states ahead of Diwali — here's how much each state will get
items.summary: The Union government will release an additional  ₹1,01,603 crore to states on 1 October 2025 for capital spending and welfare ahead of the festive season.

items.title: Lupin launches generic of Janssen Pharma’s VTE drug in U.S.
items.summary: Rivaroxaban for Oral Suspension is indicated for treatment of venous thromboembolism (VTE) and reduction in the risk of recurrent VTE in paediatric patients

items.title: 25 offshore crypto exchanges face govt action, including Huione, CEX.IO, BingX
items.summary: India's financial intelligence unit initiated a significant crackdown, issuing notices to 25 offshore cryptocurrency platforms, including major players like Huobi and Paxful. These firms operated illegally without PMLA registration, mandated since March 2023. FIU-IND ordered blocking their Indian access, emphasizing an ongoing push to formalize crypto.

items.title: NMDC’s September iron ore output rises 23%, sales 10%
items.summary: In the first half of FY26, the State-owned miner and India’s largest iron ore producer clocked more than 27% increase in output, 12% higher sales

items.title: Indian households see moderation in price pressures over a year
items.summary: RBI’s latest round of household inflation expectations survey shows that inflation expectations for the next three months and one year ahead declined by 20 bps and 30 bps

items.title: India, EFTA trade pact comes into force: Piyush Goyal
items.summary: India’s free trade agreement with the four-nation European bloc EFTA has come into force, Commerce Minister Piyush Goyal said, calling it a “historic day.” The India-EFTA Trade and Economic Partnership Agreement (TEPA) aims to boost trade, investment, and job creation.

items.title: RBI mulls further measures to internationalise the Rupee
items.summary: The aforementioned move is aimed at promoting the settlement of cross border transactions in Indian Rupee (INR) and local currencies as part of RBI’s overall efforts to internationalise the domestic currency

items.title: Cabinet okays widening of Kaliabor-Numaligarh section of NH-715 to 4-lane highway
items.summary: Project to be developed on engineering, procurement and construction (EPC) mode with total length of 85.675 km and total capital cost of ₹6,957 crore

items.title: Rs 2000 notes worth Rs 5,884 crore still in circulation: RBI
items.summary: Rs 2000 notes worth Rs 5,884 crore remain in circulation. The Reserve Bank of India announced their withdrawal in May 2023. Most notes, 98.35 percent, have returned. Exchange facilities are available at RBI offices. Individuals can also send notes via India Post for bank account credit. This process continues.

items.title: Direct & indirect tax cuts will improve savings rate in India: Chief Economic Advisor V. Anantha Nageswaran
items.summary: CEA V. Anantha Nageswaran said tax cuts and GST 2.0 reforms will improve savings and boost domestic demand. Speaking at the Reforms Reloaded 2025 summit, he noted earlier growth reduction estimates of 0.4-0.5% may be lower due to reforms. He projected FY26 GDP growth at the upper end of 6.3–6.8%, supported by tax concessions and employment generation.

items.title: India, EFTA trade pact comes into force: Union Commerce Minister Piyush Goyal
items.summary: The Union Commerce Minister said the pact will unlock new opportunities for trade, investment and job creation, benefiting people and businesses

items.title: Nike’s comeback takes shape with turnaround plans working
items.summary: Nike says efforts to roll out new products, boost marketing efforts and clear out old inventory helped blunt a longtime sales slump

items.title: FM Nirmala Sitharaman to launch nationwide awareness campaign for unclaimed financial assets on October 4
items.summary: Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman will launch a three-month nationwide awareness campaign, 'Apki Poonji, Apka Adhikar', starting October 2025. This initiative, involving key financial regulators, aims to empower citizens by providing guidance and tools to trace and claim their unclaimed financial assets. The campaign seeks to strengthen financial inclusion and ensure rightful claims for all.

items.title: Nasdaq and S&P 500 end mixed, gold hits record as US government shuts down
items.summary: S&P 500 futures and Nasdaq futures dropped about 0.5% each on Wednesday. Gold prices climbed to $3,895 an ounce, hitting a record high for a third straight session

items.title: India-EFTA trade deal couldn't have come at better time, it will be like a booster: Swiss State Secretary
items.summary: The deal is expected to cut tariffs on 92.2% of Indian product categories

items.summary: GST 2.0 reforms in the form of rate rationalisation, which came into force on September 22, have been reflected in the collections

items.title: States front-load borrowing in H1FY26, raise  ₹5 trillion
items.summary: Infrastructure push and global headwinds have driven record monthly state loans, with September alone hitting  ₹1.21 trillion.

items.title: Financial stability foremost priority, but we shouldn't impede growth through regulations: RBI Governor Sanjay Malhotra
items.summary: RBI Governor Sanjay Malhotra said financial stability remains the central bank’s top priority, even as it eases compliance and business norms to support growth. Announcing calibrated relaxations, including higher limits on loans against shares, IPO financing, and cooperative bank licensing, he stressed regulations must balance prudence with ease of doing business.

items.title: Deep depression in the making may spark stormy conditions over Bay
items.summary: India Met Department has stopped short of calling out a cyclone over the turbulent Bay, for now

items.title: Centre, states collect gross GST receipts of  ₹1.89 trillion in September
items.summary: After refunds, net GST collections were  ₹1.6 trillion, up 5%. The growth reflects resilience in India's domestic economy despite anticipated sales slowdowns ahead of GST rate changes.

items.title: RBI rolls out measures to boost rupee’s role in cross-border trade
items.summary: Steps include lending in rupees to neighbours, expanding SRVA investment options, and adding reference rates for partner currencies.

items.title: RBI plans to relax external commercial borrowing norms for India Inc
items.summary: In the works is a revised ECB framework that provides for expansion of eligible borrower and recognized lender base, rationalization of borrowing limits, and rationalization of restrictions on average maturity period

items.title: RBI’s pause: When monetary flexibility meets growth uncertainty
items.summary: With inflation easing, RBI has room to cut rates. But further rate cuts are contingent on how key risks to India's economic growth, including the US's steep tariffs, play out.

items.title: GST collections rise by 9% to ₹1.89 lakh crore in September
items.summary: The GST collections were 9.1% higher than the same month a year ago and over 1.5% higher than the previous month

items.title: India-EFTA trade deal couldn't have come at better time, it will be like a booster: Swiss State Secretary
items.summary: The free trade deal between India and the EFTA nations, comprising Switzerland, Norway, Iceland, and Liechtenstein, officially came into effect, promising transformative economic ties. Switzerland's State Secretary Helene Budliger highlighted the pact's significance, including a pledged USD 100 billion investment over 15 years and tariff reductions, emphasizing its long-negotiated nature rather than a response to current global trade disruptions.

items.title: US tariffs may stoke inflation and make rate cuts harder, says RBI
items.summary: Even as India’s economic outlook remains “resilient”, risks from evolving tariff actions, adverse weather events, and volatile global financial markets are expected to hamper growth and disinflation, the central bank said.

items.title: Kalyan Kumar takes over as MD and CEO of Central Bank of India
items.summary: Prior to his appointment, Mr. Kumar served as Executive Director of Punjab National Bank since October 2021

items.title: Cabinet hikes wheat MSP by ₹160/qtl to ₹2,585: Ashwini Vaishnaw
items.summary: Government sets record wheat production target of 119 million tonne for 2025-26 crop year (July-June)

items.summary: Sensex jumps 716 points, Nifty gains 225. Banking heavyweights Kotak, Axis, HDFC Bank and ICICI surge

items.title: Reserve Bank to link deposit insurance premiums to bank risk
items.summary: The central bank's shift from a decades-old flat-rate premium is designed to reward financially sound banks with lower costs and encourage prudent risk management across the sector; depositor protection of up to  ₹5 lakh remains fully intact.

items.title: US government shutdown threatens to disrupt IPO market momentum
items.summary: The U.S. government shut down much of its operations on Wednesday as deep partisan divisions prevented Congress and the White House from reaching a funding deal

items.summary: Reliance Industries Chairman Mukesh Ambani topped the M3M Hurun India Rich List 2025.

items.summary: This latest infusion builds on Tata Motors’ earlier investment of ₹150 crore in October 2023, bringing the total investment to ₹270 crore

items.title: Alan Scott unveils AI-powered learning assistant KrishGuru
items.summary: We believe technology can stand as a humble partner — assisting teachers, supporting parents, and guiding children step by step, says Suresh Jain, Managing Director, Alan Scott Enterprises Ltd

items.title: Monetary policy rates aren’t all that determine an economy’s credit scenario
items.summary: RBI’s rate decisions serve primarily as signals, not guarantees. Markets may choose to follow or ignore them, influenced by a mix of various factors. It’s unwise to give these signals undue importance. Globally, monetary transmission is both slower and far-from-linear.

items.title: LG Electronics India IPO size at ₹11,628 crore, values it at $8.6 billion
items.summary: The company had obtained regulatory approval for the IPO in March but in April decided to call a halt to it, citing uncertain market conditions

items.summary: RBI announces a host of measures to support exporters and stabilise the rupee; leaves repo rate unchanged at 5.5%, maintains neutral stance

items.title: India raises wheat purchase price by 6.6% to boost output
items.summary: India has increased its new-season wheat purchase price by 6.6% to 2,585 rupees per 100 kg for 2026. This move aims to encourage farmers to expand acreage and boost supplies, as growers were shifting to more profitable rapeseed. The hike ensures continued interest in wheat cultivation for the world's second-biggest producer.

items.title: Goyal takes on overseas visits to push exports, charge up EU FTA talks
items.summary: With its US trade talks facing hurdles, a deal with the EU could signal India's ability to finalize ambitious trade pacts after recent successes with the United Arab Emirates and Australia.

items.title: RBI announces host of measures to improve flow of Bank credit
items.summary: The aforementioned measures are being considered in a bid to rationalise the extant guidelines and broaden the scope for capital market lending by banks and other regulated entities

items.title: GST 2.0, festive demand cheer car/ two-wheeler makers in September
items.summary: Maruti Suzuki India domestic despatches fall, but makes record retail sales in last 10 years

items.title: New online gaming law takes effect, money games banned from today
items.summary: India's new Promotion and Regulation of Online Gaming Act, 2025, has banned online money games nationwide, effective Wednesday. This move aims to curb social and financial risks, including money laundering and terror financing. The industry is now pivoting towards eSports and social gaming, with the government envisioning India as a global game development hub.

items.title: RBI drops proposed restriction on bank-NBFC overlap
items.summary: The Reserve Bank of India scrapped plans to bar banks from overlapping business lines with their NBFC subsidiaries, offering a boost to private lenders. HDFC, ICICI, and Axis Bank shares rose as the move preserves flexibility for growth and customer targeting.

items.title: No proposal to levy charges on UPI transactions: RBI Governor Malhotra
items.summary: The Governor said the central bank is examining a proposal to allow lenders to remotely lock mobile phones bought on credit in case of default in EMI payments

items.title: Cabinet approves Rs 11,000 cr six-year plan to boost pulses production, raises MSPs for Rabi crops
items.summary: The Union Cabinet, chaired by Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Wednesday, approved a six-year, Rs 11,000 crore plan to boost domestic pulse production. The initiative aims to increase output, reduce import dependence, and strengthen food security. In a related move, the Cabinet also approved a proposal to raise the Minimum Support Price (MSP) for Rabi crops.

items.title: Trump’s drug tariff has spared most of China’s drugmakers for now but there may be worse to come
items.summary: Chinese drugmakers have been generic drug sellers but have lately begun reshaping global medicine with breakthrough therapies and lucrative deals. Could Trump’s trade policy, under which patented or branded drug imports face a 100% tariff, be aimed at stalling the rise of Chinese pharma rivals?

items.title: ATF price hiked 3%, commercial LPG up  ₹15.50
items.summary: ATF prices were hiked by over 3% or by  ₹3,053 and commercial LPG rates by  ₹15.50 per cylinder on October 1, as OMCs revised fuel prices in line with global benchmarks. Check how much fuel costs in Delhi from today.&nbsp;

items.title: DA hike for govt employees: Cabinet okays 3% Dearness Allowance rate increase ahead of Diwali
items.summary: DA Hike: The Union Cabinet approved a 3% Dearness Allowance hike, raising it to 58% for central government employees and pensioners. This significant move, aimed at combating inflation, will benefit millions and is expected to be effective from July 1, 2025, with arrears. It follows a previous 2% increase earlier in March.

items.title: Despite missing listing deadline, Tata Sons to continue doing business: RBI Guv
items.summary: “We don’t comment on any specific entities. Any entity which has a registration, till it is not cancelled, will continue to do its business,” says RBI Governor Malhotra

items.title: RBI to remove ₹10,000 crore ceiling for bank loans to corporates
items.summary: Currently, each corporate entity is allowed to take up to ₹10,000 crore of loan from the entire Indian banking sector and if lenders surpass the ceiling, they have to make heavy provisions

items.title: RBI to issue draft ECL guidelines for banks soon
items.summary: The draft directions propose to replace the current framework based on incurred loss with an Expected Credit Loss (ECL) approach, subject to a prudential floor, while retaining the existing asset classification norms

items.title: GST collection for September rises 9.1% to Rs 1.89 lakh crore
items.summary: India's GST collections surged to Rs 1.89 lakh crore in September, marking a 9.1% annual increase. Concurrently, the GST Council rationalized the tax structure, reducing four slabs to two (5% and 18%) by scrapping the 12% and 28% rates. This landmark reform, effective September 22, 2025, aims to boost consumption and ease household budgets.

items.title: Toyota sales up 16% at 31,091 units in September
items.summary: In September 2024, the automaker sold a total of 26,847 units

items.title: Bollywood's sequel strategy loses steam. At stake —  ₹2,000 crore
items.summary: The Hindi film industry’s sequel strategy is stumbling, with recent flops exposing the limits of cashing in on brand value. Experts warn only strong stories—not recycled franchises—can draw audiences.

items.title: Adani’s road-arm signs deal to acquire 100% stake in 2 highway companies
items.summary: The company, in a regulatory filing with the exchanges, said its subsidiary has executed a share purchase agreement with existing shareholder DRN Infrastructure PVt Ltd for acquiring 100 per cent stake in both these entities

items.title: India-EFTA trade pact explained: Tariff cuts, sectoral benefits, and investment commitments
items.summary: India's free trade agreement with the four-nation European Free Trade Association (EFTA) came into effect, aiming to boost commerce and investments. The pact secures a USD 100 billion investment commitment from EFTA over 15 years, potentially creating 1 million jobs in India. This deal offers significant tariff concessions for Indian exports and provides consumers with cheaper EFTA goods.

items.title: Sensex, Nifty 50 edge higher after RBI holds rates steady; banking & financial stocks gain
RBI MPC holds repo rate: Is one more cut coming in FY26? What experts hint?
items.summary: The RBI maintained the repo rate at 5.5% for the second consecutive meeting, revising FY26 GDP growth forecast to 6.8%. Experts suggest a cautious approach, hinting at potential future cuts while remaining watchful of external economic impacts.

items.summary: RBI has also outlined an enabling framework to support corporate acquisitions and proposed scrapping the 2016 restrictions that discouraged lending to large borrowers.

items.summary: RBI Governor Sanjay Malhotra announced that a discussion paper on licensing new UCBs will be released soon.

He stressed that while UPI is free due to government subsidies, the system's operational costs must eventually be borne by someone, whether collectively or individually, to ensure its continued viability and growth.

items.title: Hyundai total sales up 10% in September
items.summary: The company's domestic sales in September stood at 51,547 units, driven by festive demand across all segments

items.title: Mint Explainer | How nuclear energy gives India a strategic trump card in US trade talks
items.summary: Nuclear power is taking centre stage in the India-US trade negotiations as India strives to enhance its nuclear capacity. With ambitious plans to expand from 8.8GW to 100GW by 2047, India seeks global partnerships for small modular reactors (SMRs).&nbsp;

items.title: Festive bonanza effect? India’s Reserve Bank has done well by preserving its firepower for later
items.summary: India’s central bank did not budge on its policy rate despite subdued inflation. But then, it also raised its GDP growth forecast. Overall, it has prudently sought to balance optimism with caution in an outlier year marked by fiscal relief and global uncertainty

items.title: Why the RBI kept repo rate unchanged today and what a neutral stance means
items.summary: The RBI's Monetary Policy Committee kept the repo rate at 5.5% and maintained a neutral stance, despite stable inflation and expectations for a cut. Governor Sanjay Malhotra explained the decision was driven by moderating inflation and the ongoing impact of previous measures. The MPC is closely monitoring economic developments and global uncertainties before charting its next course.

items.title: We must navigate the three Ds that will shape our economic future: Deglobalization, derisking and deregulation
items.summary: As global trade faces disruption and uncertainty amid geopolitical tensions, countries are rethinking their strategies. India has taken a nuanced approach. Success will lie in navigating all three Ds well to balance openness with resilience and global integration with domestic strength.

items.title: Stock Market Highlights 1 October 2025: Sensex, Nifty rebound from 8-day slump after RBI holds repo rate steady at 5.5%
items.summary:

items.title: Why you should not be always chasing returns
items.summary: Most people focus on returns and chase products that offer the best returns at any point.

items.title: Jhunjhunwala-partnered fund buys stake in TFCI: What's buzzing?
items.summary: In an interview with CNBC-TV18, Satpal Arora, MD of Tourism Finance Corporation of India (TFCI), talked about the state of business and the outlook ahead.

items.title: RBI latest meeting 'diluted' its old policy framework: Nomura
items.summary: On Tuesday, the central bank surprised the market with a 25-basis-point cut to its policy repo rate, or the rate at which it lends to banks, to 6.25 percent.

items.title: Bond bull market may pause but is far from over: Expert
items.summary: The benchmark 10-year government-security yield remained stuck in 8-7.5 percent range through all of 2015 and half of 2016, moving lower to sub-7 percent only when the RBI promised in April to reduce the system's liquidity deficit. The yield may now fall more.

items.title: Scope for meaningful rate cuts going ahead: Neelkanth Mishra
items.summary: Credit Suisse' Neelkanth Mishra expects repo rate to fall to a decade low in the coming quarters. He says that beginning December the market may see a robust and widespread pick-up which may boost indices.

items.title: Tech up to a healthier world
items.summary: Sensors, 3D printed skin, wearables, reconstructed organs, revolutionized clinical trials, personalized medicine and what not – get ready for a new era of healthcare

items.title: Steel stocks rally as govt extends MIP on 66 steel products
items.summary: Stocks like Hindustan Zinc, Hindalco, Jindal Steel, JSW Steel and Tata Steel gained over 1 percent from previous close.

items.title: Endurance Technologies IPO opens: Should you subscribe?
items.summary: The Aurangabad-based company aims to mop up nearly Rs 1,162 crore (at higher end of price band) by diluting 17.5 percent stake through the issue that will close on October 7. It already raised Rs 348.52 crore through anchor investors' portion on Tuesday, the day before issue opening.

items.title: Cautiously optimistic on India; eyeing earnings revival: Sanger
items.summary: Global liquidity tailwinds are unlikely to get any better from now and that makes Arvind Sanger, Managing Partner at Geosphere Capital Management “cautiously optimistic” on the Indian markets.

items.title: Automation threatens 69% jobs in India: World Bank
items.summary: "In large parts of Africa, it is likely that technology could fundamentally disrupt this pattern. Research based on World Bank data has predicted that the proportion of jobs threatened in India by automation is 69 percent, in China it is 77 percent and in Ethiopia, the percentage of jobs threatened by automation is 85 percent," he said.
